responsibilities: Apply machine learning/deep learning to the automotive industry, including areas such as autonomous driving, manufacturing, and material design.
Maintain and enhance existing machine learning modules.
Design and implement new machine learning-based approaches based on existing frameworks.
Keep up to speed with the state of the art of academic research and technology in the industry.
Transfer technologies and solutions to Volkswagen Group.
Integrate new software modules into the framework.
Test developed modules in the prototype (unit tests, integration tests, in-vehicle/field tests, etc.).
skills: Strong communication skills - ability to explain complex technical topics to non-experts.
Team player with good collaboration and integration skills – joining people, processes, and systems.
Highly innovative and capable of seeing problems and potential solutions in a new light.
Able to work in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary, time-line, and target-oriented work environment.
Problem-solving skills.
Analytical skills.
Conceptual thinking skills.
Background in Deep Neural Network Learning, Computer Vision, and Machine Learning.
Strong programming skills with Python and TensorFlow on desktops, embedded, and distributed backends (e.g., AWS).
Experience with data gathering, data quality, system architecture, coding best practices.
Take initiative to launch projects with the ability to quickly learn and develop own ideas in an interdisciplinary environment.
Extracting high-level logical structure from low-level, multi-dimensional data.
Experience with CNNs, RNN, LSTMs, and the latest research trends.
Specification/Documentation of interfaces between software modules.
Graphical Models.
Object Detection, NLP, Scene Understanding.
Experience with C++, CUDA, OpenCV, and Matlab.
Big Data and cloud experience strongly preferred.
C++ & GPU Programming.
Passion for cars or physical products.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills focus on applying machine learning and deep learning to the automotive industry, with specific areas such as autonomous driving, manufacturing, and material design. The responsibilities include maintaining and enhancing machine learning modules, designing new approaches, and integrating software modules. The skills required include a background in deep neural networks, computer vision, machine learning, and experience with technologies like CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs, and NLP. While NLP (Natural Language Processing) is mentioned, which is a component of language models, the primary focus of the job is on computer vision, object detection, and scene understanding, which are more relevant to autonomous driving and related applications. There is no explicit mention of Generative AI or the development and deployment of language models (LLMs) as a core responsibility or skill requirement. The job seems to be more oriented towards applying existing machine learning techniques to specific automotive applications rather than developing or working with GenAI or LLMs.
